DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Collaborative Staging Version Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: This item identifies the version after CS input fields have been updated or recoded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Collaborative Staging Usage Version
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The number of the version currently used to code Collaborative Staging fields.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A coding system for staging of cancer bringing together the principles of Summary Stage, the TNM categories and stage groupings, and the SEER Extent of Disease (EOD) coding structure, creating a carefully selected set of data items that describe how far a cancer has spread at the time of diagnosis. The Collaborative Staging System uses a modified EOD coding system, a five-field, 10 digit system: tumor size (3 digits), extension of the primary tumor (2 digits), regional lymph node involvement (highest specific lymph node chain involved by tumor) (1 digit), the number of pathologically reviewed regional lymph nodes that are positive (2 digits), and the number of pathologically examined regional lymph nodes (2 digits).:Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A coding system for staging of cancer bringing together the principles of Summary Stage, the TNM categories and stage groupings, and the SEER Extent of Disease (EOD) coding structure, creating a carefully selected set of data items that describe how far a cancer has spread at the time of diagnosis. The Collaborative Staging System uses a modified EOD coding system, a five-field, 10 digit system: tumor size (3 digits), extension of the primary tumor (2 digits), regional lymph node involvement (highest specific lymph node chain involved by tumor) (1 digit), the number of pathologically reviewed regional lymph nodes that are positive (2 digits), and the number of pathologically examined regional lymph nodes (2 digits).
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: CS Version Input Current Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data item belongs to the Collaborative Stage (CS) Data Collection System which is based on the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 6th and 7th editions. This item identifies the version after CS input fields have been updated or recoded. This data item is recorded the first time the CS input fields are entered and should be updated each time the CS input fields are modified. For cases originally coded under CSv1, upon conversion from CSv1 to CSv2, CS Version Input Current will be set to 020000, a special version number to reflect its conversion status.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CS Coding Information
ReferenceDocuments.description: See the most current version of the Collaborative Stage Data Collection System (http://cancerstaging.org/cstage/manuals.html), for rules and site-specific codes and coding structures.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 16, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
